Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: AEgean \[AE]*ge"an\, a. [L. Aegeus; Gr. ?.] Of or pertaining to the sea, or arm of the Mediterranean sea, east of Greece. See {Archipelago}. [1913 Webster] ||

Aegean adj 1: of or relating to or characteristic of the prehistoric Aegean civilization 2: of or relating to or bordering the Aegean Sea; "Aegean islands" n : an arm of the Mediterranean between Greece and Turkey; a main trade route for the ancient civilizations of Crete and Greece and Rome and Persia [syn: {Aegean Sea}]
